intro: Pedicularis yanyuanensis, commonly known as the Yanyuan lousewort, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its vivid red and yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it derives some nutrients from its host plants. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
